title: Mathematics Education Curriculum Utilizing Theory-Neutral Instructional Design Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic arithmetic operations and fundamental algebraic concepts
context.additional_context: Application of a theory-neutral design framework to strengthen practical math competencies for working professionals

learning_goals: Learners can apply a theory-independent instructional design framework to solve job-related mathematical problems with 80% accuracy
Learners can analyze and compare common instructional strategy dimensions (objectives, methods, media, assessment) three or more times through formative assessments
Learners can collaborate on mathematical problem-solving processes with 90% participation using digital tools in a BYOD environment

resources: Real-time feedback-enabled online formative assessment platform

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
